assessmentItem.title: Laplace example in context: LRC step

itemBody.p:
An electrical LRC circuit is modelled by transfer function
G
s
$G(s)$
:
G
s
=
V c
V 0
s
=
1
L C
s 2
+ R C s + 1
\[ G(s) = \frac{V_c}{V_{0}}(s) = \frac{1}{L C s^2 + R C s + 1} \]
where
V
o
$V_o$
is the applied EMF (volts, V),
V
c
$V_c$
is the potential difference across the capacitor (volts, V),
L
$L$
is the inductance (henries, H),
R
$R$
is the resistance (ohms, Ω) and
C
$C$
is the capacitance (farads, F).
If
L $L$
= H,
R $R$
= Ω and
C $C$
= F, determine the potential difference across the capacitor
V c
t
$V_c(t)$
as a function of time in response to a unit step input
V o
t
$V_o(t)$
.
V o
t
=
0
if
t ≤ 0
1
if
t > 0
\begin{eqnarray*} V_o(t) &= \begin{cases} 0 & \mbox{if } t \leq 0 \\ 1 & \mbox{if } t > 0 \end{cases} \\ \end{eqnarray*}
V o
s
=
1 s
\begin{eqnarray*} V_o(s) &= \frac{1}{s} \end{eqnarray*}

feedbackBlock.p: You have had three attempts at answering this question, so here is the solution:

div.p: This solution assumes that you have used a table of Laplace transforms, such as this one.

semantics.annotation: \[ V_c(s) = G(s) \times V_o(s) = \frac{1}{0.05 s^2 + 0.6 s + 1} \times \frac{1}{s} = \frac{20}{s^2 + 12 s + 20} \times \frac{1}{s} \]

div.p:
Factorise the denominator of
G
s
$G(s)$
, using
s =
- b ±
b 2
- 4 a c
2 a
$s = \frac{-b\pm\sqrt{b^2-4ac}}{2a}$
if necessary, to find the denominators.
s
=
- iApB ±
iApB 2
- 4 × iAB
2 × 1
s
=
iA
or
s
= iB
\begin{eqnarray*} s &= \frac{-0.6\pm\sqrt{0.6^2-4\times 0.05}}{2\times 0.05} \\ s &=-2 \mbox{ or }s=-10 \end{eqnarray*}
Hence
V c
s
=
iAB
mFac1
mFac2
s
=
A mFac1
+
B mFac2
+
C s
\begin{eqnarray*}V_c(s) = \frac{\qv{iAB}}{s(s+\qv{iA})(s+\qv{iB})} = \frac{A}{s} + \frac{B}{s+\qv{iA}} + \frac{C}{s+\qv{iB}}\end{eqnarray*}

Using Heaviside's Quick Cover-Up method
A = mNumA
,
B = mNumB
,
C = iNumA
\[ A = 1\mbox{, }B = -\frac{5}{4} = -1.25\mbox{, }C = \frac{1}{4} = 0.25 \]
V c
s
= mVs
⇒
V c
t
= mAns
\begin{eqnarray*}V_c(s) = \frac{1}{s} - \frac{1.25}{s+2} + \frac{0.25}{s+10} ⇒ V_c(t) = 1 - 1.25 e^{-2t} + 0.25 e^{-10t}\end{eqnarray*}
